body_html: @girving From this similar-sounding bug in Eigen, it looks like MSVC does build with SSE3 instructions, but does doesn't define __SSE3__. Since Eigen seems to have the necessary conditionals for sending whether SSE3 is available, perhaps we could use#ifdef EIGEN_VECTORIZE_SSE3 instead?
body_text: @girving From this similar-sounding bug in Eigen, it looks like MSVC does build with SSE3 instructions, but does doesn't define __SSE3__. Since Eigen seems to have the necessary conditionals for sending whether SSE3 is available, perhaps we could use#ifdef EIGEN_VECTORIZE_SSE3 instead?
body: @girving From this [similar-sounding bug in Eigen](http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/bz/show_bug.cgi?id=136), it looks like MSVC does build with SSE3 instructions, but does doesn't define `__SSE3__`. Since Eigen seems to have the necessary conditionals for sending whether SSE3 is available, perhaps we could use`#ifdef EIGEN_VECTORIZE_SSE3` instead?
